title: Black Forest Cake II
description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake II, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in Kirsch liqueur and layered with sweet cherry filling and fluffy whipped cream. Its rich, moist texture combined with the bright cherry notes makes it a show-stopping dessert perfect for any celebration.
ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy using a mixer.
Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until well combined.
Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
Divide batter evenly between the two prepared pans and smooth tops.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool cakes completely in pans, then remove parchment paper.
Cut each cake layer horizontally in half to create four layers total.
Sprinkle each layer generously with 1/2 cup kirschwasser to soak.
In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Add confectioners' sugar, pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
Spread one-third of the buttercream filling over the first cake layer.
Top filling with one-third of the drained Bing cherries.
Repeat spreading filling and cherries on the next two layers.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake for garnish.
tips: For the best results, ensure the cakes are completely cooled before slicing and soaking with kirschwasser to prevent crumbling. Use fresh heavy cream for whipping and chill your bowl and beaters beforehand for stiffer peaks. Avoid overmixing the batter to keep the cake tender.

structured_content.content: This Black Forest Cake II is a decadent celebration of chocolate and cherries, with moist layers soaked in cherry liqueur and enveloped in fluffy whipped cream. Each bite offers a perfect balance of rich cocoa, sweet-tart cherries, and smooth cream, making it a timeless dessert that delights the senses.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour prep plus baking
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home with authentic Kirsch liqueur soak
  • Perfect for celebrations, holidays, and special occasions
  • Uses simple pantry staples and canned cherries for convenience
  • Elegant presentation with chocolate curls and whipped cream frosting

structured_content.content: I remember making this cake for a family gathering where everyone was amazed at how the layers soaked with kirsch added a subtle boozy warmth that paired beautifully with the fresh cherries. It quickly became a requested dessert for birthdays and holidays.

• Main ingredient: Use high-quality unsweetened cocoa powder for a deep chocolate flavor and fresh buttermilk for tender crumb.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Kirschwasser adds authentic cherry liqueur flavor, while vanilla extract enhances sweetness.
  • Supporting ingredients: Bing cherries provide juicy bursts of tartness, and confectioners' sugar ensures a smooth, sweet buttercream.
  • Equipment needed: Two 8-inch round cake pans, mixer, parchment paper, and a potato peeler for chocolate curls.

Preparation:
Preheat oven and prepare pans with parchment. Sift dry ingredients for even mixing. Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy, then add eggs and vanilla. Alternate adding dry mix and buttermilk for smooth batter.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Bake layers evenly until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely before slicing horizontally to create four layers. Soak each layer with kirschwasser for moistness and flavor. Prepare buttercream filling and layer with cherries between cake layers.
Finishing Touches:
Whip heavy cream with vanilla and kirschwasser to stiff peaks. Frost entire cake and garnish with delicate chocolate curls for an elegant finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure cakes are fully cooled before slicing to avoid crumbling.
  • Do not overbake to keep the cake moist and tender.
  • Look for stiff peaks when whipping cream to hold shape.
  • Store cake covered in the refrigerator; best consumed within 2 days for freshness.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cake with loved ones always brings joy and nostalgia, reminding me of festive gatherings filled with laughter and warmth. It’s a dessert that not only tastes divine but also creates lasting memories.

Enhance the cake by adding a touch of almond extract to the filling or folding fresh raspberries into the whipped cream. For a richer chocolate flavor, sprinkle cocoa nibs between layers or drizzle melted chocolate over the top before frosting.

Serve slices with a glass of chilled cherry juice or a light red wine. Pair with fresh berries or a scoop of vanilla ice cream for an indulgent dessert experience, perfect for holiday dinners or elegant parties.

For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can be made using plant-based butter, egg replacers, and coconut cream for whipping. Experiment with different fruit fillings like blackberries or mixed berries to add unique twists.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Chill cake layers briefly before slicing for cleaner cuts.
  • Use room temperature eggs and butter for smoother batter and frosting.
  • Brush kirsch slowly and evenly to avoid soggy spots.
  • Pipe whipped cream edges for a professional finish and stability.

structured_content.content: With this recipe in hand, you’re ready to create a stunning Black Forest Cake that impresses both visually and in taste. Enjoy the process and the delicious reward that brings smiles to every table.
